name: Estuary Marches
role_in_state: Primary transshipment and saltfish supply zone
economy_niches: Reagent storage & repackaging for ritual imports
culture_adjustments: Stronger Riveric Dialect substratum in local speech
Kinship organized around marsh guilds rather than ship crews
Auguries emphasize currents, mud-tides and reed-signs
Practical aversion to deep-sea voyages; focus on coastal piloting
High tolerance for salvage, jury-rigging and adaptive craft
constraints: Infrastructure vulnerable to daily tides and shifting channels
Ritual magic consumption constrained by imported reagent scarcity
Guild-controlled waterfront access limits small operators
Marsh substrate prevents heavy industrial/steam expansion
notes: Buffers open-sea routes and inland rivers; pivotal for pilotage
Saltworks often held by state guilds; labour negotiated locally
Navigation auguries essential but require local pilot knowledge
